unnormalised: So, someone asked how much folks usually spend on groceries in a month? Well, it kinda depends, ya know? Like, are you talking about a single person, a couple, or a big ol' family of 6+ people? Obviously, the answer changes. Plus, location matters too. Groceries in Mumbai are gonna cost you way more than in, say, Patna.

unnormalised: For a bachelor living in a metro like Bangalore, cooking most of his meals, I'd say around ₹4000-₹6000 per month. That's if you're sticking to basics and not eating out too much. You could easily blow past ₹10000 if you're fancy with imported stuff or order online via BigBasket everyday. And don’t forget those midnight Maggi cravings!
normalised: For a bachelor living in a metro like Bangalore, cooking most of his meals, I'd say around rupee four thousand to rupee six thousand per month. That's if you're sticking to basics and not eating out too much. You could easily blow past rupee ten thousand if you're fancy with imported stuff or order online via BigBasket every day. And don't forget those midnight Maggi cravings!

unnormalised: A family of 4 in Delhi? Hmm, I'd ballpark it around Rs 12000-Rs 20000. Again, depends on their lifestyle, where they shop (local market vs. Reliance Fresh) and how many times they order pizza on Swiggy. We're desi, so atta, dal, chawal are key! Also, if they have kids, the milk and cereal costs add up real fast, I tell ya! And what about those weekend treats from the local bakery for like Rs 500??
normalised: A family of four in Delhi? Hum, I'd ballpark it around rupees twelve thousand to rupees twenty thousand. Again, depends on their lifestyle, where they shop (local market versus Reliance Fresh) and how many times they order pizza on Swiggy. We're desi, so atta, dal, chawal are key! Also, if they have kids, the milk and cereal costs add up real fast, I tell ya! And what about those weekend treats from the local bakery for like rupees five hundred?

unnormalised: If you’re buying organic or hitting up fancy supermarkets like Nature’s Basket, multiply those numbers by at least 1.5x or even 2x. My didi lives in Gurgaon and insists on only organic veggies; her grocery bill is insane! She spends like ₹25000+ just on groceries.
normalised: If you're buying organic or hitting up fancy supermarkets like Nature's Basket, multiply those numbers by at least one point five x or even two x. My didi lives in Gurgaon and insists on only organic veggies; her grocery bill is insane! She spends like rupee twenty five thousand plus just on groceries.

unnormalised: Ultimately, best way to know is to track your own expenses for a month using an app or even just a notepad. See where your money's going – those impulse buys at the corner Kirana store can really add up! I bet if you check your grocery bills on your credit card, you will be surprised. Good luck!
